Who is Delcy Rodriguez? Venezuelan leader named interim president after Maduro’s capture
description: Venezuela entered a period of uncertainty after President Nicolás Maduro was captured during a US military operation. With no immediate political transition announced, the Supreme Court ordered Vice President Delcy Rodríguez to step in as interim president. Rodríguez condemned the US action, demanded Maduro’s release, and insisted he remains the country’s legitimate leader, even as she took charge of government functions alongside senior ministers and military officials.

description: CBSE has issued strict guidelines for Class 10 and 12 practical exams from January 1-14, 2026. Schools must ensure adequate resources, inform students, and use only Board-appointed examiners. Special arrangements are mandated for students with special needs. Marks must be uploaded daily and accurately, with no exemptions for sports participation. Non-compliance risks exam cancellation.

title: This space technology change how we manage Earth’s orbit
description: Space junk poses a growing threat to vital satellite services. Scientists at CU Boulder are developing an electrostatic tractor beam, a non-contact technology that gently nudges debris to de-orbit. This innovative approach, inspired by science fiction but grounded in physics, offers a safer and more efficient alternative to traditional cleanup methods, potentially revolutionizing orbital debris management.

The blaze, suspected to have started from a fallen electric line igniting a covered bike, gutted most of the approximately 400 vehicles. Firefighters brought the flames under control, preventing spread to station platforms.

Martyn, a 54-year-old former batter, had a distinguished career, including two World Cup wins and 13 Test centuries.

title: The stray-dog row that put school teachers on the hook; here's why they're pushing back
description: A Supreme Court safety order on stray dogs in institutional areas set off a chain of circulars: Ministry, CBSE, then Delhi DoE. Social media then twisted “nodal officer” coordination into a false “teachers counting dogs” claim, prompting police action and a teacher’s suspension. Mumbai teachers resisted similar nodal roles. The bigger fight isn’t dogs—it’s non-teaching duties and accountability.

Airlines must report all lithium battery-related incidents to the DGCA.

title: Why old books smell so good, according to science
description: The distinct aroma of old books arises from the slow chemical breakdown of paper, ink, glue, and binding materials. Volatile organic compounds are released as cellulose and lignin degrade, with vanillin and acetic acid contributing sweet and sharp notes. Storage conditions, handling, and the presence of various components collectively shape this characteristic scent.

Cookie has carved her own path as a successful author and entrepreneur, contributing significantly to their wealth and advocating for AIDS awareness.

title: Brittany Mahomes shares New Year glimpse as Patrick Mahomes continues rehab
description: Patrick Mahomes is entering 2026 focused entirely on rehab after suffering ACL and LCL tears late in the season. Andy Reid stressed patience, noting Mahomes remains around the team while prioritizing recovery over travel or timelines.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet became the 49ers’ $8.4B empire
description: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.
